content.description: start on sharp jugs head sharp right work into water runnel feature straight up to the mantely finish.
Starting is the hard part. Hold on to that crimp! Really fun route
content.location: Similar starting place to last samurai. See the small crimp head high. Move left out to sloper and then up

content.description: sit start on jugs move up on big holds and cool lay back feature.

A bit of a contrived line, but fun, technical movement on the traverse finished off with the existing Robot Nixon line.  Start inside the big, body sized dish with decent feet requiring some balance, a bit of a body tension, left hand palm press low and right on crimpy side pull.  Move hands higher across a slopey left or a couple crimpy holds higher than your head directly above starting position.  Reconfigure feet (possibly match feet) and traverse right.  We used an interesting thumb hold (beta credit to Tricky Ricky of the Circle City Hustlers) to aid the traverse and karate kick (depending on height) to the opposing wall.  Figure out body positioning and handholds to prevent the barn door and settle (or STABILIZE as they say in Brazil) on the start holds on Robot Nixon.  Finish with the established line.
content.location: Traverse starts left of Robot Nixon in the body sized dish like feature on the boulder.  Link the traverse with starting holds on Robot Nixon and top out the previously established RN line.  (there is also a line that goes directly up the boulder from the starting holds of this traverse, but it's just a couple moves)

content.description: sit start matched on pocket side pull feature, small intermediate crimps or go big to the lip, use shallow holds over lip, and get up!
left hand big pocket, right hand small shallow slot, work over the bulge using hidden holds, gain the mediocre lip hold with a sweet spot, high feet, and rock over.
sit start on jugs move up and slightly right the crux is the top out.
Start on Seymour and traverse right to finish on/top out 252525.  Avoid/climb around the tree if you are a real franchise player.
Nice boulder 5 lines with room for link ups and eliminates. mostly vertical with tricky top outs for the area(needs more cleaning) nice flat landing.
